source.3f1707f4:
# We use kind = 'box' we will get box plot 
sns.catplot(x="day", y="total_bill", kind="box", data=tips,palette=sns.diverging_palette(220, 20, n=7),size=6);
source.5263f585:
g = sns.catplot(kind ='violin',x = 'day',y='total_bill',data=tips,inner=None,palette=sns.diverging_palette(220, 20, n=7),height=6)
sns.swarmplot(x="day", y="total_bill",color='black',size=4, data=tips, ax=g.ax);

source.17d4867d:
When we are comparing two variables and one among them is categorical then we can use one of the above graphs to understand the data .However ,it depends on what type of information you are looking for is it distribution or staistical informtaion etcc..

  • If we want to know how the data is scattered we can go for SCATTERPLOT
  • If we want to know how the distribution of the data we can choose BOXPLOT or VIOLINPLOT
  • Finally , if we want to know the staistical estimate of the variable we can go for BARPLOTS

source.b57961f9:
The categorical plots are divided into three different families

  1. Categorical scatterplot
  2. Categorical distribution plots
  3. Categorical estimation plot
source.70a73a01: > If the categories are numerical seaborn orders them automatically . However we can specify the order by passing the order parameter
source.4ab7cd7a:
> Seaborn use two kinds of approaches in order to plot the scatter plot so that data belongs to each category doesn't overlap and to get better visulalization.
1. Strip Plot (Default):
   strip plot helps to adjust the positions of points on the categorical axis with a small amount of random “jitter”,and jitter is controlled by jitter parameter and we can disable it if we want

source.15db6fe6: If one of the main variables is “categorical” (divided into discrete groups) it may be helpful to use a more specialized approach to visualization
source.a4685962: > The Bar plots in Seaborn helps to get the Central Tendency of the data (by default uses mean) . It also uses bootstrapping to compute confidence interval
source.a4e7cec0: > Swarm plot is the second kind of approach used by the seaborn to plot the categorical scatter plot .It adjusts the points along the categorical axis using an algorithm that prevents the datapoints from overlapping
